article_title: Ohio physicians welcome Medicare paying for end-of-life counseling
article_text:
Total Access

Enjoy the convenience of home delivery plus Digital D. Sign up for our BEST VALUE today!

article_metadata.description: Doctors might get paid for end-of-life counseling, and some local physicians said that could lead to better planning for their older patients. “It’s about time,” Dr. Dennis Sullivan, the director of the Center for Bioethics at Cedarville University in southwestern Ohio, said on Thursday.
